p: Three antimalarial drugs were then selected to study their inhibitory actions on SARS-CoV-2 3CL pro. We found, Artemisinin, a natural compound derived from Chinese herb Artemisia annua produces the highest docking score (− 6.40 kcal/mol) as compared to O6K, chloroquine (-4.95 kcal/mol) and hydroxychloroquine (− 5.77 kcal/mol) anti-malarial molecules. Importantly, Artemisinin has demonstrated broad anti-viral activity against human cytomegalovirus, herpes simplex virus type 1, Epstein-Barr virus, hepatitis B virus, hepatitis C virus, and bovine viral diarrhea virus [ 47]. Artemisinin was shown to exhibit hydrogen bonding with His41, Leu141, Asn142, Gly143, Ser144 and Glu166 SARS-CoV-2 3CL pro amino-acid residues (Fig. 7b).
